```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

emissions_csv = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/erica16/ml1_blogs/main/data/historical_emissions.csv'
female_labor_csv = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/erica16/ml1_blogs/main/data/female-labor-force-participation-oecd.csv'
plastic_pollution_csv = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/erica16/ml1_blogs/main/data/plastic-pollution.csv'

#read in datasets
emissions_df = pd.read_csv(emissions_csv)
female_labor_df = pd.read_csv(female_labor_csv)
plastic_pollution_df = pd.read_csv(plastic_pollution_csv)

#clean data
female_labor_df = female_labor_df.dropna(how='any')
plastic_pollution_df = plastic_pollution_df.dropna(how='any')

#filter to 2010 (because its the only year the plastic pollution dataset has)
fl_2010 = female_labor_df.loc[female_labor_df['Year'] == 2010]

#merge dfs on country
labor_plastic_df = fl_2010.merge(plastic_pollution_df, on='Entity')
print("laborplastic ---------------")
print(labor_plastic_df)

labor_plastic_df.plot.scatter('Female labor force participation rate (OWID based on OECD 2017 and others)', 'Per capita plastic waste (kg/person/day)')

# Visualize the data
#emissions_fi.plot.scatter("Country", "2018")
#plt.axis([23_500, 62_500, 4, 9])
plt.show()
```
